description:
Construction of seven storey building plus basement
comprising mental health accommodation on the three lower
floors and nurses' residential accommodation on the upper
floors, an increased roof-top plant enclosure, together with
alterations to parking and refuse storage arrangement,
(amendments to planning permission PE9700758/R1).
as shown on drawing numbers:
97147/2b, 97147/01D, /03D, /04E, /05E, /06E, /07D, /08E,
/09D, /10C /11E, /12A & /17.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the [layout, sections, elevations and facing materials] to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. [Such details shall include proposed slab levels of the building in relation to the existing and proposed levels of the site and the surrounding land.] These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council. [Such details shall include details of any proposed earthworks including grading, mounding and other changes in ground levels.] 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies [EN15 if landscape details], [EN61 if trees only] [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details [by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development] [, prior to the occupation for the permitted use of the development or any phase of the development], whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 4 - No fewer than 21 parking spaces shall be provided and
    permanently retained solely for use by residential occupiers
    of this development.

Condition : 5 - Details of provision for cycle parking facilities to
    accommodate no fewer than 17 cycle stands shall be submitted
    to and approved by the Council before any work on the site
    is commenced.  The cycle parking facilities as approved
    shall thereafter be provided and permanently maintained for
    use by the residential occupiers of the development hereby
    approved.

Condition : 6 - The residential accommodation on the 2nd to 6th floor of the
    development hereby approved shall be permanently retained
    as residential accommodation for nurses employed at the
    Royal Free Hospital.

Condition : 7 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN13 and EN14 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 8 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN15 and EN16 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policy EN15 and EN16 of the London Borough
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion in accordance with the
    requirements of policies TR2 and TR4 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development and to ensure compliance
    with the Councils traffic policies in accordance with the
    requirements of policies TR2 and TR4 of the london Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the use of the accommodation accords with the
    Councils housing policies HG8, HG20, HG23 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - Please note that this permission does not include the
    discharge of condition 5 relating to cycle parking.  Please
    note that a separate application will have to be made for
    the discharge of conditions.

Condition : 14 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    place other than between the hours of 08.00am to 18.00 pm on
    Monday to Friday and 08.00am to 13.00pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 15 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under the Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Environmental Commercial
    Service (Pollution Team), Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street,
    WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020 7278 4444), or to seek prior approval
    under Section 61 if you anticipate any difficulty  in
    carrying out construction other than within normal
    working hours and by means that would minimise disturbance
    to adjoining premises.
